me.dumfing.gdxtools

Class MenuTools.Button

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.dumfing.gdxtools.MenuObject
      • me.dumfing.gdxtools.MenuTools.Button
  • Enclosing class:
    MenuTools

    public static class MenuTools.Button
extends MenuObject
    A Button that can be pressed call a OnClick method The method is called on releasing the LMB on the Button

              float y,
              float width,

        Constructor for the Button
        Parameters:
        x - The X position of the Button
        y - The Y position of the Button
        width - The width of the Button
        height - The height of the Button

      • Button

        public Button(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion pressedTexture,
              com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion unpressedTexture,
              float x,
              float y,
              MenuTools.OnClick action)
        Constructor for the Button
        Parameters:
        pressedTexture - The texture for the button when it's pressed, the width and height of the button are derived by this texture's size
        unpressedTexture - The texture for the button when it's not pressed
        x - The x position of the button
        y - The y position of the button
        action - The action for the button to run when it's clicked

      • collidepoint

        public boolean collidepoint(float mX,
                            float mY)
        Checks if a coordinate is within the area of the button
        Parameters:
        mX - The x portion of the coordinate to check with
        mY - The y portion of the coordinate to check with
        Returns:
        Returns a boolean that determines whether or not the coordinates lies within the area of the button

      • getClicked

        public boolean getClicked()
        Gets whether or not the button is pressed or not
        Returns:
        boolean for if the button is being pressed

      • draw

        public void draw(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.glutils.ShapeRenderer sr,
                 com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.SpriteBatch batch,
                 boolean debug)
        Draws the button. Will not scale or stretch the TextureRegion if it's shape isn't the same as the Button
        Parameters:
        sr - ShapeRenderer to draw the button if in debug mode
        batch - The SpriteBatch to draw the button if not in debug mode
        debug - Flag to turn on debug mode for the button

      • setPressedTexture

        public void setPressedTexture(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion pressedTexture)
        Sets the texture to be used for when the button is being pressed
        Parameters:
        pressedTexture - TextureRegion to be drawn when the button is pressed

      • setUnpressedTexture

        public void setUnpressedTexture(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion unpressedTexture)
        Sets the texture to be used for when the button is not being pressed
        Parameters:
        unpressedTexture - TextureRegion to be drawn when the button is not pressed

        public com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion getPressed()
        Gets the TextureRegion to be used when the button is being pressed
        Returns:
        The TextureRegion that the button uses when it's pressed

        public com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion getUnpressed()

      • draw

        public void draw(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.glutils.ShapeRenderer sr)
        Draws the Shape portion of the button Essentialy calls the main draw method in debug mode
        Parameters:
        sr - The ShapeRenderer used to draw the button's rectangular portion

      • draw

        public void draw(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.SpriteBatch batch)
        Draws the TextureRegion portion of the button Essentially calls the main draw method without debug mode
        Parameters:
        batch - The SpriteBatch to be used to draw the button
